name: Regatta
grape_varieties: Optima, Reichensteiner, Gewürztraminer and Schönburger, in various proportions according to the batch.
tasting_notes:
A refreshing, fruity and dry white wine, with flavours of fresh peach, lime and hints of Mediterranean herbs. A delicious, easy-drinking English wine with a smooth zesty finish. A perfect match for every dinner.
\nAll our wines are vegan friendly.
\nChoose this wine if you like...
\nPinot Grigio, Albariño
\nFood pairing suggestions
\nPasta, fish and chicken dishes, grilled veggies, creamy sauces, cheese platters, appetisers, and olives.
winemaking: A blend of three grape varieties, this is a multi-vintage wine, which means that the grapes have been picked in different years in order to combine the best features of each vintage. Fermented at a low temperature in stainless-steel vessels, the wine is also aged shortly on the lees to add texture to its naturally fruity and refreshing character.
description: A blend of three grape varieties, this is a multi-vintage wine, which means that the grapes have been picked in different years in order to combine the best features of each vintage. Fermented at a low temperature in stainless-steel vessels, the wine is also aged shortly on the lees to add texture to its naturally fruity and refreshing character.

name: Madeleine
tasting_notes:
An aromatic, floral and delicate English white wine, with hints of chamomile, fresh herbs and ripe apple. Very smooth on the palate, super refreshing with a long finish reminiscent of spring bloom.
\nAll our wines are vegan friendly.
\nChoose this wine if you like...
\nSemillon, Pinot Gris, Torrontés
\nFood pairing suggestions
\nThai food, soup, creamy risotto, cheese platters, and grilled veggies.
winemaking: Grapes are picked in mid September and fermented at a low temperature in stainless-steel vessels to retain the delicate floral characteristics. Aged for a few months in neutral vessels before release.
description: Grapes are picked in mid September and fermented at a low temperature in stainless-steel vessels to retain the delicate floral characteristics. Aged for a few months in neutral vessels before release.

name: Bacchus
tasting_notes:
This refreshing wine shows floral hints and notes of grapefruit, citrus and peach, with a slightly tropical character. Very Sauvignon Blanc-like in style.
\nAll our wines are vegan friendly.
\nChoose this wine if you like...
\nSauvignon Blanc, Chenin Blanc, Picpoul 
\nFood pairing suggestions
\nThai food, spicy food, well-seasoned chicken, seafood or vegetable dishes.
winemaking: A wine made exclusively with Bacchus grapes, the so-called 'English Sauvignon blanc'. This variety achieves excellent ripeness and concentration of flavours and aromas. Fermented at low temperatures in stainless steel vessels retains its fruity and refreshing character.
description: A wine made exclusively with Bacchus grapes, the so-called 'English Sauvignon blanc'. This variety achieves excellent ripeness and concentration of flavours and aromas. Fermented at low temperatures in stainless steel vessels retains its fruity and refreshing character.

name: King's Fumé
grape_varieties: Chardonnay and Ortega in similar quantities
tasting_notes:
A dry, elegant white wine, rich in body and complexity, with intense and persistent aromas of ripe peach, apricot, vanilla, and orange peel, and a lingering, creamy finish.
\nAll our wines are vegan friendly.
\nChoose this wine if you like...
\nWhite wines from Burgundy or California
\nFood pairing suggestions
\nRoast turkey or pork, smoked salmon, mature cheese, and vegetable risottos with rich sauces.
winemaking: A blend of Chardonnay and Ortega grapes. Fermented in stainless-steel vessels, aged on the lees with occasional stirring, and matured in a combination of old and new French oak barrels for two years. Unfined and unfiltered, the wine is made using low intervention techniques to retain its true nature.
description: A blend of Chardonnay and Ortega grapes. Fermented in stainless-steel vessels, aged on the lees with occasional stirring, and matured in a combination of old and new French oak barrels for two years. Unfined and unfiltered, the wine is made using low intervention techniques to retain its true nature.

name: Pinot Noir Rosé
tasting_notes:
Pale pink colour, dry with delicate and lingering notes of raspberry, red cherry and grapefruit. The perfect refreshing English Rosé Wine to enjoy well-chilled by itself in summer, or with fresh salads and other light meals.
\n
\nAll our wines are vegan friendly. This wine has been made following low-intervention techniques, which means that a little, non-harmful deposit can be seen in some bottles.
\n
\nChoose this wine if you like...
\nDry and delicate rosé wines.
\nFood pairing suggestions
\n

name: The Reserve
tasting_notes:
An elegant English Red Wine, with black cherry, bramble and blackberry flavours, that are perfectly balanced with a fresh, soft body and a very juicy and smooth finish.
\nAll our wines are vegan friendly.
\nChoose this wine if you like...
\nGamay, Mencía, Pinot Noir
\nFood pairing suggestions
\nBeef and lamb, mushrooms, lentils, grilled vegetables and well-seasoned, creamy soups.
winemaking: A multi-vintage dry red wine made with Dornfelder grapes that have been handpicked in different years to achieve a great balance of flavour and structure. The ageing in old oak barrels for a few months gives the wine a smooth body and a long finish.
description: A multi-vintage dry red wine made with Dornfelder grapes that have been handpicked in different years to achieve a great balance of flavour and structure. The ageing in old oak barrels for a few months gives the wine a smooth body and a long finish.

name: Pinot Noir
tasting_notes:
A very smooth red wine, with hints of red and black cherry, plum, violet and dried herbs. Extremely soft tannins, enhanced by a refreshing mouthfeel and a lingering finish. 
\nAll our wines are vegan friendly.
\nChoose this wine if you like...
\nPinot Noir from Germany or Northern Italy
\nFood pairing suggestions
\nOily fish like salmon, duck or other game birds, roast chicken, lamb, or pasta with tomato-based sauces.
winemaking: Made with a selected parcel of Pinot Noir grapes, chosen for red wine making only in the right years. A long, dry and warm season allowed an outstanding ripeness and intense concentration of flavours and aromas. This wine has been aged for one year in old oak barrels to obtain a smooth texture and a long, evolving finish.
description: Made with a selected parcel of Pinot Noir grapes, chosen for red wine making only in the right years. A long, dry and warm season allowed an outstanding ripeness and intense concentration of flavours and aromas. This wine has been aged for one year in old oak barrels to obtain a smooth texture and a long, evolving finish.

name: Heritage Brut
tasting_notes:
A light and refreshing English Sparkling Wine with delicate notes of lemon, pear and ripe green apple. Dry but fruity, the flavours of this fabulous sparkling wine linger on the palate thanks to the extra ageing it had in the bottle.
\nAll our wines are vegan friendly.
\nFood pairing suggestions
\nAn indulgent everyday fizz, the perfect dinner party aperitif, or an ideal partner to fish courses, cheese platters and creamy vegetable dishes.
winemaking: A non-vintage English sparkling produced using the Traditional Method (the same method used in Champagne and other famous sparkling wine regions of the world). The wine is aged for around one year after a second fermentation in the bottle, and is then further matured in our cellars before release.
description: A non-vintage English sparkling produced using the Traditional Method (the same method used in Champagne and other famous sparkling wine regions of the world). The wine is aged for around one year after a second fermentation in the bottle, and is then further matured in our cellars before release.

name: Stanlake Brut
tasting_notes:
Our top English Sparkling Wine with a complex bouquet of dried apple and peach with yeasty notes. Velvety and creamy on the palate. Made using the Traditional Method from classic Champagne grape varieties and aged for several years in our cellar. 
\nThe perfect English bubbles for a classy toast.
\nAll our wines are vegan friendly.
\nFood pairing suggestions
\nFish and seafood-based appetisers and canapés, white truffle, fried chicken, creamy cheeses, egg dishes, and foie gras.
\nAlso perfect wi
winemaking: A non-vintage English sparkling wine made with typical Champagne grapes using the Traditional Method. The wine is aged for several years after a second fermentation in the bottle, and further matured in our cellars before releasing.
description: A non-vintage English sparkling wine made with typical Champagne grapes using the Traditional Method. The wine is aged for several years after a second fermentation in the bottle, and further matured in our cellars before releasing.

name: Rosé Superior
category: English Rosé Wine, English Sparkling Wine
tasting_notes:
Pale colour, refreshing body with delicate flavours of raspberry, strawberry and pink grapefruit. Made from Pinot Noir grapes and aged for several years in our cellars.
\nA very elegant pink fizz.
\nAll our wines are vegan friendly.
\nFood pairing suggestions
\nPerfect with smoked salmon and shrimp cocktails, as well as duck, creamy appetisers and asparagus. Great with red berry-based desserts, like strawberry cheesecake or raspberry tart.
winemaking: A non-vintage English sparkling wine made with Pinot Noir grapes using the Traditional Method. The Rosé Superior is aged for two years after a second fermentation in the bottle, and further matured in our cellars before releasing.
description: A non-vintage English sparkling wine made with Pinot Noir grapes using the Traditional Method. The Rosé Superior is aged for two years after a second fermentation in the bottle, and further matured in our cellars before releasing.

name: Primitivo Rosé
category: English Rosé Wine, Italian Wine Collection
tasting_notes:
** SOLD OUT ** NEW VINTAGE COMING IN FEBRUARY 2026
\nA salmon-pink dry, refreshing rosé, with floral hints and aromas of fresh raspberries and strawberries. The wine has a long, smooth finish, and an aftertaste of red cherries.
\nAll our wines are vegan friendly.
\nChoose this wine if you like...
\nDry and refreshing rosé wines.
\nFood pairing suggestions
\nFried shrimp, sushi roll and sashimi, burrata and ham crostini, veggie pie, strawberry cheesecake.
winemaking: Keep in a dry and dark place, away from heat, sunlight and vibrations.
description: Keep in a dry and dark place, away from heat, sunlight and vibrations.

name: Fiano
tasting_notes:
** SOLD OUT ** NEW VINTAGE COMING IN FEBRUARY 2026
\nMade with the native Italian grape variety, Fiano, and matured under the Puglian sun. This wine shows zesty lemons and grapefruit with a floral lift, a touch of tropical fruit, and honeyed notes. Refreshing, with a relatively full-body and a long, pleasing finish. 
\nAll our wines are vegan friendly.
\nChoose this wine if you like...
\nPinot Gris, Semillon, unoaked Chardonnay
\nFood pairing suggestions
\nSoft and creamy cheese, pâté de foie gr

name: Negroamaro
tasting_notes:
** SOLD OUT ** NEW VINTAGE COMING IN FEBRUARY 2026
\nVery mature raspberries and redcurrants, with notes of prune, cinnamon and black pepper. Ripe and full-bodied but also refreshing, with a long, spicy aftertaste.   
\nAll our wines are vegan friendly.
\nChoose this wine if you like...
\nPrimitivo (Zinfandel), Malbec, Shiraz
\nFood pairing suggestions
\nOven-baked pasta, spaghetti al ragù, lamb roast, charcuterie boards, mature semi-hard cheese, grilled mushrooms.
winemaking: Keep in a dry and dark place, away from heat, sunlight and vibrations.
description: Keep in a dry and dark place, away from heat, sunlight and vibrations.

name: Hinton Brut
tasting_notes:
A slightly sparkling, refreshing English wine made in the traditional method. Elegant flavours of white flowers, ripe citrus, quince and apples. Perfect well-chilled on a summer's day. A smoother, more flavoursome and delicate alternative to Prosecco. 
\nThis non-vintage English sparkling wine is made with Pinot Noir and Seyval blanc grapes using the Traditional Method, the same technique used for Champagne and other famous sparkling wines in the world. The wine is aged for 12 months after a sho
winemaking: A non-vintage English sparkling wine made with Pinot Noir and Seyval Blanc grapes using the Traditional Method, the same technique used for Champagne and other famous sparkling wines in the world. The wine is aged for 12 months after a short second fermentation in the bottle, which gives a just slightly sparkling character, usually known as 'frizzante' in Italy.
description: A non-vintage English sparkling wine made with Pinot Noir and Seyval Blanc grapes using the Traditional Method, the same technique used for Champagne and other famous sparkling wines in the world. The wine is aged for 12 months after a short second fermentation in the bottle, which gives a just slightly sparkling character, usually known as 'frizzante' in Italy.

name: Bacchus Brut
tasting_notes:
A super refreshing English sparkling wine made with Bacchus grapes, with attractive aromas of apple, gooseberry and elderflower, and a very smooth finish.
\nThis non-vintage fizz is made with the same technique used for Champagne and other famous sparkling wines in the world, but using a grape that typically grows only in England and aged for around 12 months in our cellar.
\nAll our wines are vegan-friendly.
\nFood pairing suggestions
\nGoes perfect with seafood like smoked salmon or oysters wi
winemaking: A non-vintage English sparkling wine made with Bacchus grapes in the Traditional Method; this is the same technique used to make Champagne and other famous sparkling wines in the world. The wine is aged for 12 months after a second fermentation in the bottle.
description: A non-vintage English sparkling wine made with Bacchus grapes in the Traditional Method; this is the same technique used to make Champagne and other famous sparkling wines in the world. The wine is aged for 12 months after a second fermentation in the bottle.

name: Orange
tasting_notes:
A lovely English Orange Wine, with intense aromas of wild flowers, orange zest, cantaloupe melon and ripe peach, and an exceptional texture perfectly balanced by a crisp body, followed by a long finish. Made with the skin contact technique. 
\nAll our wines are vegan friendly.
\nChoose this wine if you like...
\nPinot Gris, Marsanne, Semillon
\nFood pairing suggestions
\nScallops, oysters, sheep’s milk cheese and spicy foods such as Indian or Asian Cuisines.
winemaking: This Orange wine was made with mature Siegerrebe grapes, with one week of skin contact, and was fermented in oak barrels. By soaking with the skins, the grape juice acquires extra fruit and tropical aromas, an oily, mouth-filling texture and a very persistent finish.
description: This Orange wine was made with mature Siegerrebe grapes, with one week of skin contact, and was fermented in oak barrels. By soaking with the skins, the grape juice acquires extra fruit and tropical aromas, an oily, mouth-filling texture and a very persistent finish.

name: Cricket Grove
tasting_notes:
A smooth and spicy wine, with flavours of black fruit, violet and vanilla, in perfect balance with velvety tannins, and a smooth, lingering finish.
\nAll our wines are vegan friendly.
\nChoose this wine if you like...
\nTempranillo, Syrah, Malbec
\nFood pairing suggestions
\nBeef and pork roast, spicy chorizo, aged hard cheese, truffle risotto, mushroom pizza.
winemaking: A multi-vintage red wine made from grapes picked from our "Cricket Field" vineyard in different years to achieve a great balance of flavour and structure. Aged in old and new oak barrels to obtain spicy hints, a smooth body, and a persistent finish.
description: A multi-vintage red wine made from grapes picked from our "Cricket Field" vineyard in different years to achieve a great balance of flavour and structure. Aged in old and new oak barrels to obtain spicy hints, a smooth body, and a persistent finish.

name: Pinot Low
tasting_notes:
Pinot Low gently captures the essence of our premium Pinot Noir Rosé wine, balancing taste with a lower alcohol content.
\n
\nOur winemaker's expertise, using earlier grape picking and lower extraction, has crafted a rosé that fits perfectly into the contemporary world of mindful drinking. 
\n
\nLight in alcohol but not in flavour, it shows delicate hints of red cherry, citrus and subtle mineral undertones, with a refreshing body. Vegan friendly. 
\n
\nPinot Low is a delicious choice for any occ

name: Berkshire Breeze - Peach
tasting_notes:
Berkshire Breeze is the ultimate crowd-pleaser. Made with Madeleine Angevine grapes and natural peach flavour, this refreshing drink perfectly combines the soft, delicious character of ripe peach with a crisp, citrusy profile. Very flavoursome, with a medium body, a fleshy finish and a slightly off-dry character. 
\n
\nAll our wines are vegan friendly.
\n
\nBest served very chilled. Delightful on its own, or for an extra refreshing twist, serve it over ice with a sprig of mint and a slice of fre
